Util Functions¶

Preprocessing module¶

Preprocessing script to clean the Dataset.

preprocessing.preprocessing.data_normalization(data: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Normalize quantitative data of the given dataframe if their skewness is greater than 2.

Parameters

data (pd.DataFrame) – Pandas Dataframe with the data

Returns

A pandas dataframe with the data with skewness > 2 been normalized

Return type

pd.DataFrame

preprocessing.preprocessing.drop_values(data: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, drop_duplicates: list, to_drop: list) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Drop data with no sense, duplicates or NaN values.

Parameters

  • data (pd.DataFrame) – Pandas Dataframe with the data

  • drop_duplicates (list) – List with the column tags to drop the duplicates

  • to_drop (list) – List with the column tags to be dropped

Returns

A pandas Dataframe with the data dropped

Return type

pd.DataFrame

preprocessing.preprocessing.eliminate_spurious_data(data: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, sort_value: str) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Clean the dataset from spurious data, negative years and non-sense data.

Parameters

  • data (pd.DataFrame) – Pandas Dataframe with the data

  • sort_value (str) – String tag value that will be used to sort the Dataframe

Returns

A pandas Dataframe with spurious data cleaned

Return type

pd.DataFrame

preprocessing.preprocessing.fill_empty_values(data: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, labels: list) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Fill empty values with zeros.

Parameters

  • data (pd.DataFrame) – Pandas Dataframe with the data

  • labels (list) – List with column tags where fill empty values

Returns

A pandas Dataframe with no empty values

Return type

pd.DataFrame

Parameters

  • non_numerical (str) – String tag with the column with non numerical values

preprocessing.preprocessing.split_X_t(data: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, x_tags: list, label_tag: str) → tuple[source]¶

Split X and t from a dataset using their colum tags.

Parameters

  • data (pd.DataFrame) – Pandas Dataframe with the data

  • x_tags (list) – List with the column tags to be used for the characteristics matrix

  • label_tag (str) – List with the column tag of the label column

Returns

A tuple containing the X pandas Dataframe and the t pandas Dataframe

Return type

tuple

Change format to datetime.

  • labels (list) – List with column tags where dates will be transform to datetime format

Returns

A pandas Dataframe with dates in datetime format

Return type

pd.DataFrame

preprocessing.preprocessing.to_last_date(data: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, ref_label: str) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Use the last date of the last year registered considered as the end of the study period.

Parameters

  • data (pd.DataFrame) – Pandas Dataframe with the data

  • ref_label (str) – List with column tags where dates will be filled with the last date registered

Returns

A pandas Dataframe with all dates filled

Return type

pd.DataFrame

Training modules¶

Wrapper module to make more usable th hyperparametersTunning and hyperparametersDNN modules.

models.models_evaluation.analize_performance_DNN(best_DNN: tuple) → tuple[source]¶

Get the best DNN model and returns the results and the numpy arrays with the test values and predicted values.

Parameters

best_DNN (tuple) – Tuple with the best neural network

Returns

A tuple with the numpy arrays with the test values and predicted values

Return type

tuple

models.models_evaluation.analize_performance_models(best_models: tuple, X: numpy.ndarray, t: numpy.ndarray) → tuple[source]¶

Get the best models and dataset values and returns the models trained and the numpy arrays with the test values and predicted values.

Parameters

  • best_models (tuple) – Tuple with the best models

  • X (np.ndarray) – Characteristic matrix numpy array of the dataset which will be evaluated

  • t (np.ndarray) – Vector labels numpy array of the dataset which will be evaluated

Returns

A tuple with the models trained and the numpy arrays with the test values and predicted values

Return type

tuple

models.models_evaluation.get_best_models(X: numpy.ndarray, t: numpy.ndarray, models: list = ['LR', 'LDA', 'KNN', 'SVC'], cv: int = 10, train_size: float = 0.8, scoring: dict = {'AUC': 'roc_auc', 'accuracy': 'accuracy', 'f1': 'f1', 'precision': 'precision', 'recall': 'recall', 'specificity': make_scorer(recall_score, pos_label=0)}, trials: int = 2, epochs: int = 50, batch_size: int = 40, metrics: tuple = ('accuracy', 'Recall', <function specificity>, 'Precision', <function f1_score>, 'AUC'), is_mthreading: bool = False) → tuple[source]¶

Return the best models generated with random hyperparameters using the arguments as training hyperparameters.

Parameters

  • X (np.ndarray) – Characteristic matrix numpy array of the dataset which will be evaluated

  • t (np.ndarray) – Vector labels numpy array of the dataset which will be evaluated

  • models (list, optional) – List with the selected model tags, defaults to HpModels.select_models()

  • cv (int, optional) – Number of folds for the cross validation algorithm, defaults to 10

  • train_size (float, optional) – % of the data to be splitted into train and test values, defaults to 0.8

  • scoring (dict, optional) – A dictionary with the wanted metrics to compare and evaluate the different models, defaults to { “accuracy”: “accuracy”, “recall”: “recall”, “specificity”: make_scorer(recall_score, pos_label=0), “precision”: “precision”, “f1”: “f1”, “AUC”: “roc_auc”, }

  • trials (int, optional) – Number of trials used to generate random models with different hyperparameters, defaults to 2

  • epochs (int, optional) – Number of maximum iterations allow to converge the algorithm, defaults to 50

  • batch_size (int, optional) – Size of the batch used to calculate lossing function, defaults to 40

  • metrics (tuple, optional) – Tuple with the metrics to compare and evaluate the differene neural networks, defaults to ( “accuracy”, “Recall”, cm.specificity, “Precision”, cm.f1_score, “AUC”, )

  • is_mthreading (bool, optional) – Boolean to enable/disable multithreading during the training of the models, defaults to False.

Returns

A tuple containing a tuple with the best_models and train_size and a tuple with the bestDNN model

Return type

tuple

models.models_evaluation.get_hyperparams(model: sklearn.base.BaseEstimator, tag: str) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Wrapp the get_hyperparameters function in hyperparametersTunning module.

Return a pandas DataFrame with the hyperparameters of the given model.

Parameters

  • model (BaseEstimator) – Model to get hyperparameters

  • tag (str) – Name of the model to get hyperparameters

Returns

A pandas DataFrame with the hyperparameters used in the given model.

Return type

pd.DataFrame

models.models_evaluation.get_hyperparams_DNN(model: tensorflow.python.keras.engine.sequential.Sequential) -> (<class 'pandas.core.frame.DataFrame'>, <class 'pandas.core.frame.DataFrame'>)[source]¶

Wrapp the get_hyperparams function in hyperparametersDNN module.

Return the hyperparams of the model passed as an argument.

Parameters

model (keras.models.Sequential) – A keras.models.Sequential neural network model

Returns

A tuple with a pandas Dataframe with the hyperparameters of the neural network and a pandas Dataframe with the parameters of the optimezer used in the model

Return type

tuple

  • best_DNN (tuple) – Tuple with the best neural network

Returns

Module to implement customized metrics for the neural networks.

models.customized_metrics.f1_score(y_true: numpy.ndarray, y_pred: numpy.ndarray) → float[source]¶

Define the f1_score metric to implement in keras models.

Parameters

  • y_true (np.ndarray) – Numpy array containing the true values

  • y_pred (np.ndarray) – Numpy array containing the predicted values

Returns

A float number with the value of the metric calculated

Return type

float
